com.ndi

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ndi.Table

  • class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of a table-like object using Hash Table, thus providing effective look-up of entries. Used as an internal data structure for quickly identifying if an entry exist in a given column.Note that creating index on a empty table is Illegal and might lead to unexpected behavior. This class has package access, which means that you probably shouldn't use this class unless you are trying to modify or expand com.ndi package.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(java.util.List<java.lang.String> cols,
             java.lang.String primaryIndex)
        Initialize a table. It takes the following two arguments
        Parameters:
        cols - the list of columns for this table
        primaryIndex - the column that will be the primary index for this table
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the table column is empty or the primaryIndex is not one of the columns, or either of the two arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tuple)
        Adding a row of entries into the Table.
        Parameters:
        tuple - the list of row entries, which should be an instance of java.util.ArrayList. The size of it also needs to match with the number of columns provided when constructing the table. Also the ArrayList must ordered in the same way the original columns are ordered, corresponding to the column each row entry belongs to. Also the primary row key cannot be null or a IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. Secondary index is allowed to be null, however, this will mean that we won't be able to query certain entries using only the secondary row key. Note that secondary index can contains duplicate entries
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the argument is null or the size of the tuple does not match with the size of the column

      • isRowKey

        public boolean isRowKey(java.lang.String rowKey)
        check if the provided rowKey is a primary key
        Parameters:
        rowKey - the row key
        Returns:
        if the provided row key is indeed a primary key

        public boolean isSecondaryRowKey(java.lang.String rowKey,
                                 java.lang.String column)
        Check if the provided row key is indeed a secondary row key
        Parameters:
        rowKey - the secondary row key
        column - the column where the secondary row key is located
        Returns:
        whether this is a valid secondary row key

        public java.lang.String getEntry(java.lang.String colKey,
                                 java.lang.String rowKey)
        Get the table entry with the provided column key and the row key
        Parameters:
        colKey - thee column name
        rowKey - the primary row key
        Returns:
        querying the entry at column == colKey and row == rowKey

                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> rowKeys)
        Querying result given a single colKey and a list of rowKeys
        Parameters:
        colKey - column key
        rowKeys - a list of row keys
        Returns:
        a list of querying result

      • getEntry

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getEntry(java.lang.String colKey,
                                                 java.lang.String secondaryRowKey,
                                                 java.lang.String RowKeyCol)
        Get the table entry with the provided column key and row key that is not a primary key, thus we need to specify which column this row key comes from
        Parameters:
        colKey - a column key
        secondaryRowKey - a secondary row key
        RowKeyCol - the column this secondary row key is in
        Returns:
        querying the entry at column == colKey, row == secondaryRowKey
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the colKey or the rowKey does not exist

      • getEntry

        public java.lang.String getEntry(int colIndex,
                                 int rowIndex)
        Get the table entry with column number and row number
        Parameters:
        colIndex - the column number (starting from 0)
        rowIndex - the row number (starting from 0)
        Returns:
        the entry in the (colIndex)th column and (rowIndex)th row

      • createIndex

        public void createIndex(java.lang.String colName)
        Construct index on a particular column for fast searching of an entry based on that column. The column must be one of the column keys, or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. Note that this method can only be called when we have at least one row, or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        colName - the name of the column that we want to create an index for
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when attempt to create an index on column that does not exist

      • createIndexMultiValueColumn

        public void createIndexMultiValueColumn(java.lang.String colName,
                                        TableFormat.Format entryFormat)
        Construct index on a particular column that has multiple values listed in one single entry. Other than that, it does exactly what createIndex does
        Parameters:
        colName - the name of the column that we want to create an index for
        entryFormat - an instance of TableFormat.format object, specifying how this multi-value entry is split (See tableFormat documentation for more details)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when attempt to create an index on column that does not exist

      • convert2primaryKey

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> convert2primaryKey(java.lang.String row,
                                                            java.lang.String column)
        When looking up for a particular entry by its column key and a row key that is not a primary row key, it is required to convert the non-primary row key into a primary row key. This method does the appropriate conversion. If the column is not a primary index, this method will call createIndex() on that column However, if the row key does not exist in the provided column, an IllegalArgument Exception will be thrown. This is a private method used internally by the other methods
        Parameters:
        row - the non-primary row key
        column - the column this row key appears in
        Returns:
        the primary row key that match with the non-primary row key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when key does not exist

      • size

        public int[] size()
        Querying the current size of the table
        Returns:
        an array where the first entry is the number of row, and the second entry is the number of columns in the table
